channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Commercial vehicle left on corner of junction, 9th July
item.description:
A small van has been left blocking the corner of the junction at the location marked. It has been 3 weeks and counting without any sign of movement. There are belongings on display so could be a vandalism problem as well.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Guan Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: New barrier on a cycle path which is dangerous to cyclists, 9th July
item.description:
At some point today (8/7/24), a new barrier was placed at the end of the Honeybourne line by the POW stadium. This new barrier is dangerous to cyclists. I'd invite someone from the council to try cycling around this barrier on a cargo bike, bike with trailer, or a tandem, while someone is cycling towards them. Many parents use the Honeybourne line to take their kids to nursery using bikes with trailers, and this is now impossible. I am not sure who installed this barrier, but it needs to be rectified before someone is seriously hurt.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Honeybourne, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 9th July
item.description:
The tree bases are overgrown and poorly maintained. The grids at the base of the trees were removed some 18 months ago apparently to make maintenance easier, however, since then no maintenance has taken place. The younger trees at the east end of the Broadwalk are the worst with weeds and tree suckers extending some 2 meters, acting as a litter trap.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cycle Lane Full of debris, 9th July
item.description:
The new cycle lane coming out of Charlton Kings towards the Seven Springs roundabout is full of debris and needs urgent REGULAR cleaning. It has been this was since the cycle lane was put in. The normal carriageway for motor vehicles would not be allowed to be kept in this state. A road sweeper won’t cut it. It need operatives with brooms. The road won’t need to be shut as it is segregated from motor traffic
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cirencester Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain cover has collapsed into a pothole, 9th July
item.description:
In the road going from Noverton Lane towards Cheltenham, in the gutter of the road. Address is outside Lilian Faithfull care home known as Bay Tree Court, roughly half way along the front block of flats

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: One side does not bleep to tell you it is safe to cross, I have a grandsons that cross this road in the mornings for school, one of which is blind therefore i feel this is very important for any one who has this disability for it to be corrected asap., 9th July
item.description:
Traffic crossing Evesham road for access grangfield school
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree too tall opposite Buttermilk Lane, 9th July
item.description:
The tree has grown so tall it is catching on the cables above. When it's windy it pulls on the cables.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 94, Parton Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.title: Whilst it it's only an inch, we have had lots of parents of the school complain they have tripped on this., 9th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Scholars Court, Marle Hill, Cheltenham

item.description:
2 HR WITH GIVE AND TAKE MAKE SAFE WITH X4 BARRIERS AND X8 SANDBAGS PLUS X2 FOOTWAY CLOSURE BOARDS NEEDED (Damaged Street Furniture)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: General weed issues - Alleyway in Cherston Court, 9th July
item.description:
I am reporting overgrown weeds down the alleyway at the back of mine and my neighbours gardens. The grass verge is cut by the council so I’m not sure why they aren’t using a strimmer. The weeds in some places at nearly the height of the fence! It’s also causing weeds to grow underneath our fences into our gardens as you aren’t controlling the growth!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cherston Court, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
